body: Thanks for the reviews. Merged to trunk.

Thanks for the catch @omkreddy. I intended to view the code as `return this.writable && (this.compressor.numRecordsWritten() == 0 ?
            this.initialCapacity >= Records.LOG_OVERHEAD + Record.recordSize(key, value) :
            this.writeLimit >= this.compressor.estimatedBytesWritten() + Records.LOG_OVERHEAD + Record.recordSize(key, value));`  when I wrote it but obviously I got the Java Operator Precedence wrong.

LGTM and merged to trunk.
@omkreddy If you have the time, I still think it would be useful to include a test as discussed. If you have the time, please submit that via a separate PR.
@Ishiihara @hachikuji @gwenshap Should be an easy review, and @gwenshap need you to commit :)
LGTM
LGTM, thanks!
@gwenshap If you have a moment, have addressed review comments
LGTM
The latest system test results from this branch are here: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/413/
Thanks for the review @miguno I wait for your and @guozhangwang comments to open points before pushing a new version.
LGTM
@SinghAsDev Thanks for the update - just need to rebase and this should be good
LGTM
LGTM
@guozhangwang A couple of minor nits, but the implementation of `toString` seems like it could cause problems
LGTM
@ijuma any update on this?
@xvrl, We need @junrao or another committer to review this.
@ijuma if @junrao is not available, can you think of anyone else that might be able to review this?

Done, thanks for the reviews!

On Fri, Apr 22, 2016 at 9:49 AM, Geoff notifications@github.com wrote:

> @SinghAsDev https://github.com/SinghAsDev Thanks for the update - just
> need to rebase and this should be good
> 
> —

> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1160#issuecomment-213506677

## 

Regards,
Ashish

@SinghAsDev You're welcome!
@ewencp Mind taking a final look?

@granthenke thanks for the PR. I left a few minor comments, looks good otherwise. I think one thing worth paying special attention to is the `errorUnavailableEndpoints` change, but it seems like Gwen has already done that.

Checkstyle failure: `streams:checkstyleTest[ant:checkstyle] /x1/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/streams/src/test/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/kstream/internals/KGroupedTableImplCountTest.java:34:1: Disallowed import - org.hamcrest.core.Is.is.`

Do we have to introduce this dependency? In general we want to have as less external dependencies as possible.

1. It is a test dependency - so api users don't see it.
2. it doesn't include any new jars.
3. This has been a standard way of writing junit tests for a number of years
Do you mind also generating protocol docs and making sure the new protocol is documented correctly?
@joshng @ewencp @ijuma Could you take another look?

Thank you for the review @SinghAsDev!

Looking at the failed build, I don't think it appears related to the change here. Running tests locally via `testAll` passes for me.

@guozhangwang even if we solve the rebalance issue by adding a new API to the consumer (which is not clear if we will), this speeds up initialisation significantly for some of the use-cases right? I think that's pretty important from an ease of development perspective (libraries that start-up quickly are much more enjoyable to use). So, unless I am missing something, it seems to make sense for us to include this.
@dguy @ijuma @guozhangwang @miguno please have a look if you can.

@rajinisivaram Thanks for running the system tests. Are you going to update some of the system tests to test the mechanism functionality? Also, weren't there some unit (as opposed to integration) tests for SASL in a previous iteration of the PR?
@gwenshap, I have verified that new api and error shows up on generated docs.
Three tests are failing, stay tuned.
Works now.

@ijuma @enothereska @miguno for reviews.
1. Add a `close()` function in `KStreamTestDriver`, which closes the state stores in the topology, so that RocksDB will not be destroyed by static deconstrutor.
2. Use `@Rule` for temporary folder, which will be deleted after the test; and remove the `finally` block for deleting the folder.

Ran the branch on Jenkins for 15+ rounds, and do not see the `virtual method` issue again.
LGTM, tests pass for me (above failure seems to be unrelated).
LGTM modulo @ijuma 's comments. Tests ran locally fine.
Code LGTM. Tests also ran fine (Jenkinds failure below is unrelated). Thanks.
I re-ran the test locally and they pass for me. The failed test in Jenkins is unrelated. LGTM.

@rajinisivaram : Thanks for the patch. Looks good to me. Just had a minor comment.

Also, once the vote for KIP-35 passes, would you be up for adding the support of ApiVersionRequest in the Sasl authenticator layer since you are more familiar with the logic there?
@junrao, can you please take a look and see if this is what you had in mind? Also, it would be good to know your thoughts about the naming of the sensor, metrics and metrics group. cc @fpj
LGTM. Why does Travis show "All Checks have failed", but "Details" show "Test Result (no failures)" ?
Thanks @dguy @ijuma @miguno
@guozhangwang @miguno @enothereska Please review.
Thanks for the PR. I think the PR title would be better as `KAFKA-3599: Remove unused WindowStoreUtils` or something along those lines.
Ups. It should not get removed, but moved to different package... Just fixed this.
OK :)
Jenkins failure are `virtual methods`, locally runs pass.

@Ishiihara Just want to confirm that this is only an issue when running from source right? When running from a release the only line that loads jars in `kafka-run-class.sh` is the following:

``` bash
# classpath addition for release
CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:$base_dir/libs/*
```

It shouldn't stop this change but I would love to have kafka-run-class.sh work the same for both source builds and release builds. If not done here I can open a jira to track that.
Thanks for your feedback, @dguy!
LGTM

@ijuma This change basically amortize the initialization cost to the first few records processing time, and hence the total latency will be the same; plus for many topologies where processors are connected sequentially, you will likely initialize all the stores on processing the first record. So I feel from user's perspective it does not improve their experience a lot, though for some cases the amortization does make sense for them.

@dguy: Some background information regarding [your earlier comment](https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1255#issuecomment-213600069):  The Kafka project has been pretty sensitive to introducing new dependencies, including test-scope dependencies.  That said, I'm on your side. :-)  This question is perhaps something we should discuss with other Kafka folks, because -- intentionally over-simplified -- I'd prefer us not to be stuck with `assertEquals` until eternity...
@guozhangwang : Can you take a look again?  It'd be great to include this test improvement before the 0.10 release.
@rajinisivaram Thanks for the PR. I have completed my review now and left some comments.
Other than few minor comments, it looks good to me. @hachikuji and @edenhill, want to take a look as well?
:+1: Looks good, will verify broker bits with librdkafka
Also, could you patch the DumpLogSegment tool to support the time index?

@ijuma @junrao Thank you for the reviews. I have made most of the updates suggested and left a few comments. I had moved the SASL unit tests out of this PR to make it easier to keep it updated (since the tests have quite a bit of refactoring that makes it hard to rebase). Once this is committed, I will rebase and submit the additional tests in another JIRA. I will also submit the PR for system tests of the changes - I think it should be sufficient to run only a few tests with PLAIN, PLAIN+GSSAPI.

@junrao I will be happy to submit the PR for handling ApiVersionRequests during SASL handshake as well, once the new request is added for KIP-35.

@rajinisivaram, thanks for updating the PR. I reviewed your updates and left some very minor comments. The main item left on this PR in my opinion is how we name the inter-broker sasl mechanism property. I think it would be better if the config name is consistent with the property for inter-broker security protocol (ie there is an `inter.broker` in the name). Let's see what @junrao thinks.

Before 0.10.0.0, we need to:
1. Add unit, negative and system tests for this PR
2. Add handling of ApiVersionRequests during SASL handshake

Would you mind please filing JIRAs with 0.10.0.0 as the "Fix version"?
@becketqin Will you have a chance to rebase this soon?

I have completed my review. Mostly minor comments with a couple of exceptions:
1. Testing that involves the `KafkaApis` code
2. A couple of naming questions, which I think are important to agree on a path forward before we merge.
This is now being done under KAFKA-3149.

@ijuma Thank you for reviewing the updates. Have filed new JIRAs for the remaining work:
- KAFKA-3617 : Add unit tests for SASL authenticator
- KAFKA-2693 : Ducktape tests
- KAFKA-3618: Handle ApiVersionRequest before SASL handshake
Jenkins failure is tracked in #1258. LGTM and merged to trunk. Thanks @dguy !
@miguno I brought in one more utility method (borrowed from you), as well as swapped the stores test, which is not great, with the one that tests compact topics which is a better starting point.
@becketqin, it would be nice to have some numbers for how long it takes to do search by timestamp before and after the change on a cluster with a reasonable amount of data.

@ijuma Please review again.

I did not make `KStreamTestDriver` extending `ExternalResource` and keep the `@After` process. If we want to make that change I'd prefer do it in a separate PR.
@ewencp Could you take a quick look again?
@ijuma @granthenke Thanks for the review. I updated the patch to have more specific filtering condition and also make sure that we also filter files in case that we run from binary package.
LGTM. Merged to trunk. Thanks @gfodor !
@guozhangwang: Do we want to update `KStreamTestDriver` so that it's usable as an `ExternalResource`?
@apovzner, it looks like this was merged via different PRs, would you mind closing this one please?
@soumyajit-sahu, are you still planning to add unit tests?
@llowrey Would you mind closing this PR since we merged the change via a different one in the end?
@llowrey Would you mind closing this PR since we merged the change via a different one in the end?
@llowrey Would you mind closing this PR since we merged the change via a different one in the end?
@miguno As I mentioned above, I'd prefer to do it in a separate PR.

It seems [another pull request](https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1262) was already created for this. Even though there was no sign from [the corresponding JIRA ticket](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3614) it was already picked up by someone. I'm closing this one.
Closed because the code in this PR was two KAFKA JIRAs so I separated it into two separate PRs and already merged.
Thanks @rajinisivaram, LGTM.

@gwenshap @ijuma @granthenke @edenhill @hachikuji I am done with addressing most of the review comments here, however I am wondering if it is OK to rename `ApiVersion` in Req/Resp and API keys to `ApiVersions` given that KIP-35 has it stated as `ApiVersion`?

@ijuma Is there a specific use case where the performance of searching by timestamp matters much? Supposedly searching by timestamp should be a relatively rare operation. With LogAppendTime, the time will be similar to offset search. With CreateTime, the time cost largely depends on how the data look like. i.e. if we have to scan tons of logs, it is going to be slow, otherwise it is fast. One thing for sure is that it is going to be slower than before which did not do much except for looking at the last modification time of segment files.
@SinghAsDev - ApiVersion and ApiVersions is a tiny change and no one is using the API yet (since we didn't commit yet...), I see no problems. Whatever you see fit is fine by me :)
Go ahead with renaming it.
Merged to trunk.
@ijuma Could you take another look?
LGTM overall. Could your rebase this PR?
@ijuma pinging for  review and commit
@ijuma pinging for review
@ijuma pinging for review
Nice catches, thanks @jklukas!  LGTM.
LGTM. Merged to trunk.
@mjsax I'm always wondering the same :) Does Flink Jenkins job has different displays? Maybe that is something we can improve on the configuration.
@junrao Would you mind taking another look at this and let me know if it looks good?
@guozhangwang Done.
Merged to trunk.
@guozhangwang Flink uses Travis, not Jenkins. It works without problems there.

@guozhangwang Generally, it would be better not to introduce technical debt and then fix it in cases where the fix is straightforward. However, this helps with test stability, so I am OK for this to be merged before we do KAFKA-3623 if you address the two minor comments I left and you edit the PR description to mention that the duplication will be handled as part of KAFKA-3623 (no additional review is needed).
The change suggested in this PR was included as part of KAFKA-1989. Would you please close the PR (we cannot close it ourselves without help from Apache Infra).
